intro: Platostoma busbanianum, commonly known as the Busbanian rock-moss, is a species of liverwort found in rocky and humid environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-like growth form. The plant has a thalloid structure with a green, flattened body that is often covered in small, leaf-like structures. It thrives in shaded, moist areas and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
